image.altText: Exterior photos of a youth detention centre.

props.synopsis: Former Ashley Youth Detention Centre detainees alleged they had suffered, witnessed, or were threatened with sexual abuse, serious physical abuse and false imprisonment while at the centre.

title.children: Judge approves 'momentous' $75 million settlement for former Ashley Youth Detention Centre detainees

image.altText: University of Tasmania logo on clothing.

props.synopsis: A few years ago, the University of Tasmania proposed about 1,200 dwellings including medium-rise apartment buildings above its Sandy Bay campus. It sparked a furious response — but the land is back on the agenda.

title.children: A university in need of cash, a city in need of housing. Is parliament about to grant UTAS's wishes?

image.altText: An aerial image looking down on a number of canoes around rocks on the edge of a fast-moving river.

props.synopsis: A 65-year-old Lithuanian man remains in a critical condition after being trapped and partially submerged in the Franklin River for 20 hours. Medical crews amputated the man's left leg to free him.

title.children: Man who had leg amputated in Franklin River rescue in critical condition

image.altText: Large Aboriginal flag flying on city street with crowd in background

props.synopsis: For some Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, receiving an Australian of the Year award can be used to draw attention to important issues. But others feel unable to accept a nomination because the timing of the awards is too painful.

title.children: 'Not an easy decision': Many First Nations people are conflicted about Australian of the Year Awards

image.altText: Woman helping a man using a wheelchair into a van.

props.synopsis: When Taraidh became quadriplegic 18 months ago, it turned his family's emergency plans on their head. A new program is helping equip people like him with the tools they need to prepare.

title.children: 'It will save lives': Disaster emergency preparedness workshops offered for Tasmanians with disability in pilot project

image.altText: a woman uses large hedge trimmers to tidy up a box hedge next to another woman standing in front of a rose bush.

props.synopsis: Nestled within the walls of the world heritage-listed Woolmers Estate sits Tasmania's largest rose collection. The sprawling 1.5 hectare garden is largely maintained by about a dozen volunteers.

title.children: These volunteers care for Tasmania's largest rose garden. Here's their tips and tricks

image.altText: A woman is pushing a child on a swing, she has a child on her back and a third child is on a second swing

props.synopsis: Parents in this island community, which has no child care services, were "very excited" when an early learning trial for three-year-olds was promised by 2024. Now, with no progress made on delivering that, parents want answers.

title.children: Did you miss? 📣 On this island there's no childcare and a promised early learning initiative is behind schedule

image.altText: Travis Head raises his bat towards the crowd

props.synopsis: Australia has five wickets remaining, but a near-insurmountable target to chase on a wearing pitch as India looks to wrap up a 1-0 series lead at Perth Stadium. Follow live.

title.children: Travis Head brings up defiant half-century as Steve Smith's form slump continues on day four

image.altText: Blood pressure being monitored by nurse

props.synopsis: New research from Australia's leading medical institute has found treating patients with high blood pressure is costing taxpayers $1.2 billion annually.

title.children: Treatable, deadly condition costing Australian economy $1.2 billion a year

image.altText: A man with brown hair takes a selfie with grass and open space behind him

props.synopsis: Financial advisor Kris Ridgway's life began to unravel in early 2022 when it was discovered he was recommending unlisted shares to his clients. As Ridgway faces up to 15 years jail, his wife Kerrilyn says she's lost her past, and her future.

title.children: 'My husband of 36 years was a conman': Estranged wife of Kris Ridgway says his scams left her with a life sentence

image.altText: Orange clouds over the Sydney skyline

props.synopsis: Parts of the state are on track to swelter through five consecutive days above 35C, with the NSW government receiving reports that the electricity grid could be under pressure.

title.children: Hot weather across the state leads to risk of blackouts, warns Australia's energy grid operator

image.altText: Emma McKeon smiles with four gold medals

props.synopsis: Australia's most successful Olympian in history announces she is retiring from competitive swimming having won 14 medals at the Games.

title.children: 'I wanted to see what I was capable of and I did': Olympic great Emma McKeon announces her retirement

image.altText: A young Muslim woman withher right eye bandaged up lies in a hospital bed

props.synopsis: Doctors are battling to save 20-year-old Ranem Abu Izneid's eyesight, after she was injured this month.

title.children: Australian student accuses Israel Border Police of firing bullet which may rob her of her vision

image.altText: A city scape by the sea, with grey smoke coming out of buildings

props.synopsis: Hezbollah and Israel have continued trading fire with more than 100 Lebanese killed coinciding with signs of progress in US-led ceasefire talks.

title.children: Lebanon ceasefire pending Israeli response after it carried out deadliest attack on Beirut

image.altText: Sam Hibbens wears a white collared shirt, navy suit jacket and blue stripped tie and stands with his arms folded, smiling

props.synopsis: Former Victorian Greens deputy leader Sam Hibbins was cut from a state parliament internship program following an allegation he tried to kiss a university student during his first term as an MP.

title.children: Former parliamentary intern alleges ex-Victorian Greens MP tried to kiss her

image.altText: A coat of arms on a mantle.

props.synopsis: The magistrate questioned the Department of Communities' plan to work with the boy far from his home region.

title.children: Magistrate expresses grave concerns as WA's 'most vulnerable child' faces 10 fresh charges

image.altText: A yellow flag that says "open home" flying off a yellow real estate sign advertising an auction.

props.synopsis: First-home buyers in Queensland used to be banned from claiming stamp duty concessions if they rented out part of their property – but that rule has been lifted.

title.children: First-home buyers in Qld allowed to rent out a room under new changes

image.altText: A woman voting at night at a cardboard polling booth

props.synopsis: The era of Baby Boomers as the dominant voting force in Australian politics is at an end and the impact will play out at the next federal election. If you listen carefully, you can already hear that politicians know the power and numbers have shifted to younger people.

title.children: Farewell Baby Boomers as Gen Z and Millennials become Australia's key voting force

image.altText: A man holding a phone takes a selfie

props.synopsis: Armina Hayat, 19, had complained to friends about her husband, Meraj Zafar, being violent towards her in the lead up to her death in January 2022.

title.children: 'He burned the face I used to kiss': Father of aspiring doctor murdered by husband tells killer he broke a family

image.altText: A man whose face has been blurred is held under arrest by 3 people in a police station

props.synopsis: A 20-year-old man has been arrested and charged by NSW Police for allegedly damaging cars and buildings in Sydney's east, days after anti-Israel language was spray-painted across the area.

title.children: Man charged days after buildings and cars spray-painted with anti-Israel graffiti in Sydney's east

image.altText: A pregnant, brown mare in a field.

props.synopsis: Legendary race mare Winx gave birth to a "healthy and happy" foal in the early hours of this morning. The mare's first foal, a Pierro filly, sold for $10 million but experts say it is hard to put a value on her half-brother.

title.children: 'Impossible to know' value of champion racehorse Winx's second foal, expert says

image.altText: A close-up of a fire ant being held by tweezers.

props.synopsis: Experts say riverbank infestations of fire ants are exploding south of Brisbane, and there's a risk the venomous pests could spread further through flooding.

title.children: These venomous pests can float on floodwaters, and thousands of nests have been found south of Brisbane

image.altText: portrait of older woman done in broad brush chunky style

props.synopsis: Artist Ben Quilty gets behind the crowdfunding campaign to buy his Archibald Prize-winning portrait of Margaret Olley and return it to the north coast.

title.children: Gallery asks public to chip in to buy iconic Archibald Prize-winning portrait

image.altText: A man floats on an object while watching houses in burn in the background.

props.synopsis: About 1,000 homes have been reduced to wreckage and ashes after fire ripped through a slum area of the Philippine capital Manila.

title.children: 'Everything is gone': Fire tears through Manila slum area

image.altText: Three women pour water over beached whales in a bid to keep them healthy

props.synopsis: Pilot whales that perished in two mass strandings in south-west WA over the past two years are found to be carrying salmonella, something not detected in the species before.

title.children: Scientists surprised to find salmonella present in bodies of beached pilot whales

image.altText: Sun setting on large housing development.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's largest developers says it has paused work on a major housing estate after delays meant contracts had to be cancelled.

title.children: Home buyers' contracts cancelled as major developer pauses work on housing estate

image.altText: Giant screen on the wall of the ASX, with large green numbers, showing the price of shares which have risen.

props.synopsis: The ASX 200 opens 0.6 per cent higher, setting it up for a new record high after Wall Street's post-election rally rolled on to finish the week on a high note. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX opens 0.6 per cent higher, primed for new record as Wall Street rally rolls on, SG Fleet soars on takeover bid

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX up 0.7%, banks stumble and SG Fleet soars
ASX opens 0.6% higher primed for record close, SG Fleet soars on takeover talks
Private equity lobs a $1.2 billion takeover bid at SG Fleet Group

image.altText: A view of a town from the top of a hill with an Indigenous art piece of a man with a spear admiring the view.

props.synopsis: A lack of aged care facilities in WA's far north often means Indigenous elders have to leave their country and culture behind, but an aged care provider in Roebourne is helping them see out their final days.

title.children: Aged care centre recognised as the best in rural Australia. So what is it doing differently?

image.altText: A voter puts a Senate paper into a ballot box for the 2016 federal election.

props.synopsis: Labor says its proposal is about getting big money out of politics, but crossbenchers and Clive Palmer say they are shutting out competitors.

title.children: A re-run of the 2022 election reveals how Labor's new funding rules really work

image.altText: A group of men hold their fists up with flags behind them.

props.synopsis: The ceasefire deal was struck by a Pakistani government team after days of clashes between rival sectarian groups Armed Shia and Sunni Muslims.

title.children: Seven-day ceasefire deal struck between rival sectarian groups in Pakistan

image.altText: Printed photo of a young girl and boy playing with action figures.

props.synopsis: Georgy Sides and her friends grew up with absent fathers who served their country in Afghanistan in the wake of September 11. Now they're sharing their stories of how Australia's commitment to a distant theatre of war altered their adolescence and shaped who they are today.

title.children: 'We could never build a relationship': Life when your dad is in the SAS

image.altText: Action shot of Jelena Dokic at the Australian Open

props.synopsis: Jelena Dokic opens up about experiencing family violence as a child and during her tennis career.

title.children: Tennis star Jelena Dokic needed security '24 hours a day' to protect her from her dad

image.altText: An image of a phone with social media app logos floating around it

props.synopsis: As senators gather to discuss the federal government's planned social media ban for under-16s, some young people feel the bill will reduce harm but negatively impact their ability to communicate.

title.children: Here's what year 7 students think of the government's proposed social media ban

image.altText: Red Bull driver Max Verstappen punches his fists and screams with excitement

props.synopsis: The mark of a true F1 great is not what you can do when you have the best car. It is how you can overcome setbacks to win — just like Verstappen in 2024.

title.children: Max Verstappen joins the exclusive list of all-time F1 greats with a fourth world title — and this was his best
